III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 08/10/24 Youth A refused to clean to his room. Staff 1
punched Youth A in the chest.
Investigation Case Manager was interviewed via phone on 8/19/2024. She
reported having no further information beyond the allegations
outlined in the complaint.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/19/2024. She reported knowing Youth A called 911 but did not
know the allegations of Staff 1 hitting Youth A. She reported there
is camera footage showing the hallway but not what might occur in
the bedrooms. She will provide all the necessary information.
Administrator reported Youth A has never been restrained since
being placed in the facility.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/19/2024. He reported yelling at Staff 2 when Staff 1 who was
sitting in a chair in the hallway outside of Youth A’s room grabbed
Youth A’s arm and pushed Youth A away. Youth A reported Staff
1 punched Youth A in the chest because Staff 1 knew Youth A
doesn’t like to be touched. Youth A reported Staff 1 told Youth A,
that Staff 1 can touch Youth A all Staff 1 wants. Youth A believed
this action by Staff 1 to be abuse so Youth A called Law
Enforcement. Youth A reported there were no witnesses to the
punch or touching because this took place in Youth A’s room.
Youth A reported being restrained if yelling which confuses Youth
A because Youth A reported being told at the beginning of his stay
at the facility, that youth are only restrained as a last resort. Youth
A reported entering the program on 7/31/24 feeling safe but
wanting to leave the facility.
2

Supervisor was interviewed via phone on 8/26/2024. She
reported supervising Staff 1 and having no issues with Staff 1.
She reported this is the first-time hearing about any issues with
Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 8/26/2024. He reported
remembering the incident and recalled Youth A was upset
because Youth A didn’t want to do the task staff asked Youth A to
do. Staff 1 reported the task was for Youth A to clean up Youth A’s
room. Staff 1 reported he was sitting in the hallway when Youth A
came out of his room charging and yelling at Staff 2. Staff 1
reported putting up his leg to slow down Youth A and then
standing up to get between Youth A and Staff 2. Staff 1 walked
with Youth A back to Youth A’s room and attempted to verbally
deescalate Youth A on the way. Staff 1 left Youth A’s room and 5-
minutes later, Youth A came out of the room telling Staff 1, Youth
A was going to call 911 because Staff 1 punched Youth A in the
bedroom. Staff 1 denied touching Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 8/29/2024. She reported
Youth A became angry when asked to clean Youth A’s room. Staff
2 reported Staff 1 was sitting in a chair in the hallway outside of
Youth A’s room when Youth A came out of Youth A’s room yelling
and charging towards Staff 2. Staff 1 put his leg up to slow down
Youth A and then stood up, getting between Youth A and Staff 2.
As Staff 1 walked with Youth A back towards Youth A’s room Staff
2 reported leaving the area and not witnessing anything else. Staff
2 reported never observing Staff 1 mistreat Youth A and described
Staff 1 as a very calm and gets along well with the youth. Staff 2
reported taking Youth A to the emergency room and the doctor
telling Staff 2 that there was no marks or bruising on Youth A’s
chest area. There was a bruise on Youth A’s wrist which is in the
hospital report.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 9/17/2024. Staff 3
reported being present at the situation outlined in the allegation.
She reported not observing any inappropriate action taken by
staff. Staff 3 reported her involvement in the situation was
redirecting Youth A to Youth A’s room prior to Youth A calling Law
Enforcement. She described Youth A as struggling with anger and
following directions. Youth A tends to bump into others and charge
after staff and youth when upset.
Video Review:
The video recording is from the end of the hallway showing Youth
A’s bedroom door and the location of the incident outlined in the
3

allegations was reviewed. At the beginning of the video Staff 1 is
sitting in a chair outside of Youth A’s bedroom and Youth A is
standing to the right of Staff 1 and appears to be talking to Staff 1.
Youth A goes into his room and a few moments later rushes out of
Youth A’s bedroom headed towards Staff 2 who is standing down
the hall from Staff 1. Staff 1 raises his leg slightly and stands
blocking Youth A from moving towards Staff 2. Youth A turns and
walks back into Youth A’s room and Staff 1 stands in the doorway
for a few seconds before he sits back down. Youth A again
charges out of Youth A’s bedroom headed towards Staff 2 who is
still down the hall from Staff 1. Again, Staff 1 raises his leg as he
stands up and blocks Youth A from moving towards Staff 2. Youth
A tries to get around Staff 1, but Staff 1 is able to block Youth A
each time. Youth A goes back into Youth A’s room followed by
another staff (unidentified). This unidentified staff stands in the
doorway before leaving the area. A moment later, Youth A
charges out of the bedroom running past Staff 1 who is standing in
the hallway and grabs the phone.
Documents Reviewed:
De-Escalation form/Calming form dated 8/2024 for Youth A.
This document outlines the presenting behaviors, triggers/trauma
history, warning signs, and intervention strategies for Youth A.
Staff are to identify early signs of anger or dysregulation through
careful observation and aim at establishing a detailed
understanding of Youth A’s behavioral patterns. Interventions are
identified as playing outside, video games, watching videos as
methods to help Youth A calm down. Fresh air, movement, and
exercise are also listed.
Christ Child House Incident report dated 8/10/24 @ 1:45 pm
authored by Staff 1. This document outlines the incident
described in the allegations. Staff 1 documents Youth A becoming
upset when asked to clean his room. Youth A is described as
becoming verbally and physical aggressive while charging
towards Staff 2. Staff 1 documents putting his leg out to slow
down Youth A before standing up and then walking Youth A back
to Youth A’s bedroom. A “couple of seconds later” Youth A came
out of the bedroom saying Staff 1 hit Youth A and Youth A wanted
to call 911.
Christ Child House Incident report dated 8/10/24 @ 1:55 pm
authored by Supervisor. It is documented that Staff 2 informed
Supervisor that Youth A was attempting to attack Staff 2 before
Staff 1 blocked Youth A’s path to Staff 2. It is documented Youth A
ran to the phone and dialed 911 telling the operator that Youth A
4

was being abused. Law Enforcement arrived at the facility and
spoke with Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 2. Youth A finally began to
calm down after speaking to Law Enforcement.
Christ Child House Incident report dated 8/10/24 @ 1:45 pm
authored by Staff 2. This document outlines the incident reported
in the allegations. Staff and youth (including Youth A) are outside
and wanted to go to their rooms, when Staff 2 informed all youth
that they must clean their rooms before the next activity. Youth A
informed Staff 2 that Youth A was not going to “clean shit”. Once
inside and in Youth A’s room Youth A began to clean by throwing
all of his items in the closet. Staff 2 informed Youth A that it was
inappropriate for Youth A to throw these items in the closet to
which Youth A became upset and started to charge towards Staff
2 in the hallway. The rest the report matches what was reported
during Staff 1 and Staff 2 interviews.
Christ Child House Incident report dated 8/10/24 without a
time authored by Staff 2. This document outlines that Youth A
grabbed the phone and called 911. After speaking to Law
Enforcement, Youth A went back to his room and 15 minutes later
Law Enforcement arrived at the facility and took statements.
Christ Child House Incident report dated 8/10/24 @ 1:00 pm
and authored by Staff 3. This document outlines the incident
involving Staff 1 and Youth A. It documents Youth A was asked to
go to Youth A’s room and fold Youth A’s clothing, but Youth A
became angry and charged Staff 2. Staff 1 blocked Youth A from
getting to Staff 2 and redirected Youth A back to Youth A’s room.
Staff 3 documented once in Youth A’s room, Youth A said Youth A
was going “to kill Staff 2”.
Christ Child House Discipline & Behavior Management Policy
dated 1/26/2022. This document outlines staff’s response when a
youth becomes dysregulated, and an intervention is needed. Staff
are to have knowledge of each youth’s de-escalation form that
provides a youth’s diagnosis, trauma history, triggers, and
interventions. When engaged in the intervention, staff are to utilize
the CPI supportive stance by maintaining an appropriate distance
from the youth.
Staff 1’s personal file was reviewed. Documentation indicates
Staff 1 was hired on 5/15/2022 and there are three disciplinary
actions documented in this file for being on his cell phone and not
locking vehicle door. Documentation also indicates Staff 1 is
5

current on required training and completed the nonviolent Crisis
Intervention refresher on 6/9/2024.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as interviews with staff and
video review does not support the allegations made by Youth A
since Staff 1 is never fully in the room with Youth A and not
observed to punch Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
